intro: Lepismium aculeatum, commonly known as the spiny nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its unique appearance and nocturnal blooming habit make it a fascinating subject for botanical study.
